The Hiding Place. A classic and a true story!! It will for sure bring tears to your eyes. 
📚 📚📚📚📚📚📚📚📚📚 A little about the book:
Corrie Ten Boom is an unmarried woman who worked with her father and older sister at their watch shop. They were strong believers of the Bible. When World War II began, they began to house Jews who where in danger of being captured. With the help of family and friends they saved many Jews but can they save themselves? I guess you will have to read the book to find out!😉

This book is an amazing history book, but it does have some violence and descriptive death scenes. So I recommend this book for YA and above. I give this book⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ because it teaches us the history of our world and what it was like for Jews and other people in World War II. Even my dog @izzyminipoo likes the  book!🐶 Happy reading!!

Oh wow. Such truth. 
If I’m honest, for many years I walked this walk - and it’s incredibly easy to slip down this slope each day. 

COMPARISON: It’s always a trap. 
Whether I’m looking at others with envy, 
looking at others and questioning my own value and worth, 
or looking at others through  prideful eyes from up on a pedestal ...

Lord help me keep my eyes on myself. 
Open my eyes so I can see myself as You do. 
And if I notice the error of others’ ways, 
may it first prompt me to pray for them 
and never allow it to build my own pride.

This bush was the only thing in bloom around me. Go a few feet to the left or right, and things would have been brown, dirty; the ordinary side of a building, the cracked asphalt road, twisted trees bent from Texas wind.

I used to think that zeroing in on the pretty parts was FAKE. That trying to focus on what you wanted to see was silly, surface-level, and shallow.

But what we choose to see is linked to the deepest part of our hearts.

"Happiness isn't something that depends on our surroundings. It's something we make inside ourselves." -The Hiding Place by Corrie Ten Boom.

Are you looking at the flowers today, friend? Or at the weeds?

⁣
Joe has moved to the one town he said he’d never live, home. While we aren’t entirely sure of Joe’s reasons, we know that he has some unfinished business which may relate to the murder/suicide that occurred in the cottage he’s renting. ⁣
⁣
I really enjoyed the flashbacks of this book and when they were kids. It reminded me of a mix between IT and Pet Semetary. Unfortunately I didn’t feel that the current story was as exciting. I did enjoy the tie in and the end when everything came together. I still have some unanswered questions though!⁣

Number 54: I managed to squeeze another book in this year. It was fascinating to read more about the experience of a resistance fighter and an insight into how many did not lose their faith in God when they were forced into concentration camps. A question that has always puzzled me but now I feel has more of an answer. #thehidingplacebook #corrietenboom

Corrie Ten Boom is one of those people who exemplified the most remarkable faith and has forever impacted my life and worldview.  She, along with her family, were Dutch nationals who helped hide and rescue Jews during WWII.  The family was arrested for their actions and Corrie was imprisoned alongside her sister Betsie in concentration camps.  Betsie died in the camp.  The girls led Bible studies, worship services and continually praised God throughout their imprisonment, and after the war ended Corrie returned to the Netherlands where she began a rehabilitation center for concentration camp survivors. The girls’ faith was poignant and bold – praising God for even the fleas in their barracks, which they only later learned were the reason that the guards did not come in to rape and harass the women as they did the other women.  Corrie made this simple, yet profound statement. 

Jesus has already overcome the world.  He has defeated sin and eternal death, and is delaying the end of the Age for the salvation of many.  But the war is already over, the end has already been written and we know that He will bring all of His own into His final rest. Look to Jesus and have rest!

Forty-year-old teacher Joseph Thorne, the narrator of this devastating thriller from British author Tudor (The Chalk Man), moves home to Arnhill, takes a job at his old school, and rents the cottage where a woman recently murdered her 11-year-old son before committing suicide. Joe claims that he wants to give back to the community, but he actually returned to the former mining village because of an anonymous email: “I know what happened to your sister. It’s happening again.” Joe is determined to avenge his eight-year-old sister, Annie, who went missing decades ago, but there are forces conspiring against him. Further complicating matters are a vicious loan shark and the apparent haunting of Joe’s new house. Flashbacks to 1992 gradually reveal what tragedy befell Annie, while sharply drawn characters illustrate the cyclical natures of violence and victimhood. Joe’s dark humor may balance the grim plot, but the epilogue is the stuff of nightmares...... I recommend it although for me the end was kinda weak and left me wanting more 😂 still an awesome read #crazymomhorrorbooks #cjtudor #thehidingplacebook #lazyreadingevenings #lazydayreadinghorror #librosinteresantesdehorror #adiccionalibrosdehorror

I am deeply contemplating these words today and will continue to ruminate on them awhile.
.
Whenever I am asked how I am doing... BUSY.  When I think of what I have going on in life... BUSY.  When I consider our family mode... BUSY.
.
While working hard and doing things are not inherently bad... an excess can be, or even just not having the room to listen and respond to the Holy Spirit’s direction certainly is.
.
Weighing my busy is an important step in keeping healthy... not only physically, but mentally, and especially spiritually. 
Is what I’m doing each moment of my day a reflection of my walk with the Lord? 
Is it in direct obedience to His calling in my life? 
Am I balancing things on my own, or am I sharing the load with the Creator of all things that promises to be with us always?
.
I am always impacted by Corrie ten Boom’s story.  Hearing her words again as my daughter finished The Hiding Place for our homeschool studies layered the dynamics for me.  So many quotes to remember and reminders of faith to cling to.
.
Who is one of your heroes that both inspires and challenges you?
